explains: n. 总统（主席，校长）的职位（任期）；（基督教）（牧师或司铎）圣餐主持；监督，主管

sentences.en: 1945 to 1946 was the nadir of Truman's presidency.
sentences.cn: 1945至1946年是杜鲁门总统生涯的最低点。

sentences.en: He was already preparing his run for the presidency.
sentences.cn: 他已经在为总统竞选做准备。

sentences.en: He was a White House official during the Bush presidency.
sentences.cn: 他是布什任总统时的白宫官员。
